1.verse: Address -Chapter 1 -Greeting to the Church. -Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, and Timothy our brother, to the Church of God in Corinth, and to all the saints throughout Achaia:

2.verse: grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

3.verse: Sufferings and Consolation. -Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercy and the God of all consolation.

4.verse: He consoles us in all our afflictions and thereby enables us to console others in their tribulations, offering them the consolation with which we ourselves are consoled by God.

5.verse: For just as we share abundantly in the sufferings of Christ, so too, through Christ, do we receive our consolation.

6.verse: If we are being afflicted, it is for your consolation and salvation. If we are being consoled, it is to help us to console you and give you the patience and the strength to endure the same sufferings that we endure.

7.verse: Our hope for you is unshaken, because we know that as you share in the sufferings, you also share in the consolations.

8.verse: Brethren, we do not want you to be unaware of the hardships we experienced in Asia. The burden we endured was far too heavy for us to bear, to such an extent that we even despaired of life itself.

9.verse: Indeed, in our hearts we felt that we were under a sentence of death. This was so that we not put our trust in ourselves but in God who raises the dead.

10.verse: He delivered us from this deadly peril, and he will continue to so deliver us. He on whom we have set our hopes will deliver us again,

11.verse: as you assist us with your prayers, so that thanks may be given by many to God on our behalf for the blessing granted to us through the prayers of so many.

12.verse: Apostle by the Power of Jesus and for Jesus -A Visit Not Made -You Are Our Boast. -Indeed, this is our boast: the testimony of our conscience that in our dealings with the world, and especially with you, we have conducted ourselves with simplicity and godly sincerity, depending not on worldly wisdom but on the grace of God.

13.verse: For we write nothing to you that you cannot read and comprehend. It is my hope that you will come to understand fully,

14.verse: as you have already understood in part, that on the day of the Lord Jesus we will have as much reason to boast of you as you will have reason to boast of us.

15.verse: Our Language Is Not “Yes” and “No.” -So certain am I of this that I had originally intended to come to you first of all and thereby reward you with a double benefit.

16.verse: I planned to visit you on my way to Macedonia, and then to come to you again on my return from Macedonia and have you send me forth to Judea.

17.verse: Since that was my original intention, was I being impulsive, or do you believe that my plans are based on human considerations, ready to say “Yes, Yes” and “No, No” at the same time?

18.verse: As surely as God is faithful, our word to you has not been “Yes” and “No.”

19.verse: The Son of God, Jesus Christ, who was proclaimed to you by us, that is, by Silvanus and Timothy and me, was not a mixture of “Yes” and “No.” He was never anything but “Yes.”

20.verse: In him is the “Yes” to every one of the promises of God. Indeed, it is through him that we say “Amen” to give glory to God.

21.verse: However, it is God who enables both us and you to stand firm in Christ. He has anointed us

22.verse: and marked us with his seal and given us the Spirit in our hearts, as a down payment of what is to come.

23.verse: The Delay Was Intended Merely To Spare Them. -I call upon God as a witness that it was only to spare you that I did not come again to Corinth.

24.verse: We do not wish to lord it over your faith, but to work together with you for your joy, because you are standing firm in your faith.

1.verse: Chapter 2 -Therefore, I made up my mind not to have you endure another painful visit.

2.verse: For if I cause you pain, then who would be there to cheer me up aside from you whom I offended?

3.verse: And I wrote as I did, so that when I came I would not suffer distress from those who should have made me rejoice. I know all of you well enough to be certain that we both share the same joy.

4.verse: It was with great distress and anguish of heart and many tears that I wrote to you, not to grieve you but to let you know how abundant is the love I have for you.

5.verse: Forgiveness for the Offender. -If anyone has caused distress, he has done so not only to me but to some extent—not to exaggerate—to all of you.

6.verse: The punishment that was imposed by the majority was appropriate.

7.verse: But now you should forgive and encourage him so that he may not be overwhelmed by the burden of his distress.

8.verse: Therefore, I urge you to reassure him of your love.

9.verse: I wrote to you to test your obedience in all matters.

10.verse: Anyone whom you forgive I forgive as well. Whatever I have forgiven, if I have forgiven anything, I have done for your sake in the presence of Christ,

11.verse: so that we may avoid being outwitted by Satan, for we are not unaware of his schemes.

12.verse: Paul’s Anguish. -When I came to Troas to proclaim the gospel of Christ, and a door of opportunity was opened for me in the Lord,

13.verse: my mind knew no relief because I could not find my brother Titus in that place. And so I said farewell to them and moved on to Macedonia.

14.verse: Greatness and Weakness of the Apostles -Ambassadors of God. -But thanks be to God, for he brings us to victory in Christ and through us he manifests the fragrance of the knowledge of him throughout the world.

15.verse: We are indeed the aroma of Christ to God both among those who are being saved and among those who are perishing:

16.verse: to the latter, the odor of death that leads to death; to the former, a fragrance of life leading to life.Who is truly qualified for such a task?

17.verse: For we are not like so many others who adulterate the word of God for profit. When we speak, we do so in Christ and in all sincerity, as men sent from God and standing in God’s presence.

1.verse: Chapter 3 -A Letter from God. -Are we beginning once again to commend ourselves to you? Surely, as is true in some cases, we do not need letters of recommendation to you or from you.

2.verse: You yourselves are our letter, one that is written on our hearts, so that it may be known and read by all.

3.verse: And you make it clear that you are a letter from Christ entrusted to our care, a letter written not with ink but with the Spirit of the living God, and written not on tablets of stone but on tablets of the human heart.

4.verse: Such is the complete confidence in God that we have through Christ.

5.verse: Obviously, we are not competent of ourselves to take credit for anything as coming from us. Our competence comes from God

6.verse: who has empowered us to be the ministers of a new covenant, not written but of the Spirit. For the letter kills, but the Spirit gives life.

7.verse: Ministers of a New Covenant. -Now if the ministry of death, engraved with letters on stone, was so glorious that the Israelites could not fix their glance on the face of Moses because of its glory, a glory that would soon fade,

8.verse: how much greater will be the glory of the ministry of the Spirit?

9.verse: For if the ministry of condemnation was glorious, how much richer in glory will be the ministry of righteousness!

10.verse: Indeed, what was once glorious is now without any glory in comparison with the surpassing glory.

11.verse: For if what was destined to fade away was glorious, how much greater will be the glory of that which endures!

12.verse: The Lord Is the Spirit. -Therefore, since we have such hope, we can act with complete confidence,

13.verse: and not like Moses who put a veil over his face so that the Israelites could not observe the radiance that was fading away.

14.verse: However, their minds were hardened. Even to this very day, the same veil remains unlifted during the reading of the old covenant, since only in Christ is it set aside.

15.verse: Indeed, to this very day, whenever Moses is read, a veil lies over their hearts.

16.verse: However, when one turns to the Lord, the veil is removed.

17.verse: Now this Lord is the Spirit, and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is freedom.

18.verse: And as we gaze upon the glory of the Lord with unveiled faces, all of us are being transformed into that same image from glory to glory, which comes from the Lord, who is the Spirit.

1.verse: Chapter 4 -The Gospel of the Glory of Christ. -Therefore, since we are engaged in this ministry through the mercy of God, we do not lose heart.

2.verse: Rather, we have renounced all shameful and hidden ways. We do not engage in deception or falsify the word of God. By stating the truth in an open manner, we commend ourselves to the conscience of everyone in the sight of God.

3.verse: If our gospel is veiled, it is veiled to those who are perishing,

4.verse: those unbelievers whose minds have been blinded by the god of this world to prevent them from seeing the light of the gospel of the glory of Christ, who is the image of God.

5.verse: We do not proclaim ourselves. Rather we proclaim Jesus Christ as Lord and ourselves as your servants for the sake of Jesus.

6.verse: For the God who said, “Let light shine out of darkness,” has enabled his light to shine in our hearts in order to enlighten them with the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.

7.verse: The State of an Apostle. -However, we hold this treasure in earthen vessels so that it may be clear that this immense power belongs to God and does not derive from us.

8.verse: We are afflicted on all sides but not crushed, bewildered but not sunk in despair,

9.verse: persecuted but not abandoned, struck down but not destroyed.

10.verse: We always carry around in our body the death of Jesus, so that the life of Jesus may also be manifested in our body.

11.verse: For in our lives we are constantly being given up to death for Jesus’ sake, so that the life of Jesus may be revealed in our mortal flesh.

12.verse: As a result, death is at work in us, but life in you.

13.verse: Therefore, since we have that spirit of faith about which it has been written: “I believed, and therefore I spoke,” we also believe, and therefore speak.

14.verse: For we know that the one who raised the Lord Jesus will raise us also with Jesus and bring us side by side with you into his presence.

15.verse: Indeed, everything is for your sake, so that the grace that is abundantly bestowed on more and more people may cause thanksgiving to superabound, to the glory of God.

16.verse: An Eternal Dwelling in Heaven. -Therefore, we do not lose heart. Even though our outer self is continuing to decay, our inner self is being renewed day by day.

17.verse: Our temporary light afflictions are preparing for us an incomparable weight of eternal glory,

18.verse: for our eyes are fixed not on what is seen but rather on that which cannot be seen. What is visible is transitory; what is invisible is eternal.

1.verse: Chapter 5 -Now we know that if the earthly tent in which we live is destroyed, we have a dwelling prepared for us by God, a dwelling in the heavens, not made with human hands, that will be eternal.

2.verse: While we are in this earthly tent, we groan, longing to be clothed with our heavenly dwelling;

3.verse: for when we have put it on, we will not be naked.

4.verse: While we are enclosed in this earthly tent we groan, burdened because we do not wish to be stripped naked but rather to be further clothed, so that our mortal state may be swallowed up by immortality.

5.verse: God is the one who has prepared us for this destiny, and he has given us the Spirit as a pledge of this.

6.verse: Therefore, we are always confident, even though we realize that as long as we are at home in the body, we are exiles from the Lord,

7.verse: for we walk by faith, not by sight.

8.verse: Yet we are filled with confidence, even as we long to be exiled from the body and be at home with the Lord.

9.verse: For this reason, whether at home or away, we strive to please him.

10.verse: For all of us must appear before the judgment seat of Christ, so that each one may receive suitable recompense for his conduct in the body, whether good or bad.

11.verse: Well Known to God. -And so, with this fear of the Lord always foremost in our thoughts, we try to persuade others. We ourselves are well known to God, and I hope we are also well known to your consciences.

12.verse: We are not once again commending ourselves to you, but we are rather affording you an opportunity to boast about us. Then you will have an answer to those who boast of external appearances and not the heart.

13.verse: If, indeed, we are out of our minds, it is for God; if we are rational, it is for your sake.

14.verse: The Ministry of Reconciliation. -For the love of Christ urges us forward, once we conclude that one has died for all, and therefore all have died.

15.verse: And he died for all, so that those who live might no longer live for themselves, but for him who for their sakes died and was raised to life.

16.verse: Therefore, from now on we will not regard anyone according to human standards. Even though we once judged Christ from a human point of view, we no longer do so.

17.verse: Consequently, anyone united to Christ is a new creation. The old order has passed away. Behold, all has become new.

18.verse: All this has been done by God, who has reconciled us to himself through Christ and entrusted us with the ministry of reconciliation.

19.verse: In other words, God was in Christ, reconciling the world to himself, and not holding people’s transgressions against them, and he committed to us the message of reconciliation.

20.verse: Therefore, we are ambassadors for Christ, since God is appealing to you through us. We implore you through Christ to be reconciled to God.

21.verse: He made him who did not know sin to be sin for our sake, so that through him we might become the righteousness of God.

1.verse: Chapter 6 -As his coworkers, we urge you not to receive the grace of God in vain.

2.verse: For he says,“In an acceptable time I have listened to you,and on the day of salvation I have helped you.”Behold, now is the acceptable time; behold, now is the day of salvation.

3.verse: Ministers of God. -We avoid placing obstacles in anyone’s way, so that no fault may be found with our ministry.

4.verse: On the contrary, in everything we do we present ourselves as ministers of God: in steadfast perseverance; in afflictions, hardships, and distress;

5.verse: in floggings, imprisonments, and riots; in labors, sleepless nights, and fasts;

6.verse: in purity, knowledge, patience, and kindness; in holiness of spirit, genuine love,

7.verse: truthfulness, and the power of God.We wield weapons of righteousness with right hand and left,

8.verse: in times of honor or dishonor, praise or insult. We are regarded as impostors, and yet we speak the truth;

9.verse: as unknown men, and nevertheless we are well known; as dying, and behold we live on; as scourged, but we are not put to death;

10.verse: as sorrowful, and yet we are always rejoicing; as poor, and yet we make many rich; as having nothing, and yet we possess everything.

11.verse: Relations Have Been Established -Paul’s Heart Is Wide Open. -O Corinthians, we have spoken frankly to you, and we have opened our heart to you.

12.verse: We are not withholding our love from you, but you have withheld yours from us.

13.verse: I speak to you as my children. In return, also open wide your hearts to us.

14.verse: What Relation Can There Be between Righteousness and Iniquity? -Do not associate with unbelievers. For what basis can there be for a partnership between righteousness and lawlessness? What do light and darkness have in common?

15.verse: Can Christ ever be in accord with Beliar? What does a believer have in common with an unbeliever?

16.verse: Can there be an agreement between the temple of God and idols? For we are the temple of the living God, and for this we have God’s word:“I will live in them and walk among them.I will be their God,and they shall be my people.

17.verse: Therefore, come out from their midstand separate yourselves from them,says the Lord.Do not touch anything unclean,and I will welcome you.

18.verse: I will be a father to you,and you shall be my sons and daughters,says the Lord Almighty.”

1.verse: Chapter 7 -Since we have these promises, beloved, let us cleanse ourselves from anything that can defile flesh or spirit, and thereby make our holiness perfect in the fear of God.

2.verse: Trust Reestablished. -Make room in your hearts for us. We have wronged no one, we have corrupted no one, we have exploited no one.

3.verse: I do not say this to condemn you, for I have already told you that your place in our hearts is secure, so that we will live together and we will die together.

4.verse: I have great confidence in you, and I boast about you with intense pride. Despite all of our afflictions, I am greatly encouraged and overflowing with joy.

5.verse: Even when we arrived in Macedonia, we were unable to rest our bodies, for we were afflicted in every way: conflicts on the outside and fears on the inside.

6.verse: But God, who comforts the downcast, encouraged us by the arrival of Titus—

7.verse: and not merely by his arrival but also by the encouragement he received from you. He told us of your longing for me, your deep regrets, and your zeal for me, all of which cause me even greater joy.

8.verse: Even if I did cause you sorrow with my letter, I do not regret it. I did regret this letter briefly, but, having come to realize that you were sorrowful only for a short time,

9.verse: I now am able to rejoice, not because you were grieved but because your sorrow led to repentance. For you were sorrowful in a godly way and so received no harm because of us.

10.verse: Such godly sorrow results in repentance that leads to salvation and causes no regret, whereas worldly sorrow produces death.

11.verse: For see what earnestness this godly sorrow has produced for you, what eagerness to repent, what indignation, what fear, what yearning, what zeal, what desire to see justice done. In every way, you have proved your innocence in this matter.

12.verse: Therefore, even though I wrote to you, it was not on account of the one who committed the offense or on account of the one who was wronged, but rather that you should be fully aware of your zeal for us in the sight of God.

13.verse: In this we have been greatly encouraged.In addition to being encouraged ourselves, we rejoiced still more at the joy of Titus, because his mind has been completely refreshed by all of you.

14.verse: Anything I may have said to him in boasting about you has not caused me to feel ashamed. But just as everything we said to you was true, so our boasting to Titus has proved equally true.

15.verse: And his affection for you grows even more as he recalls the obedience of all of you and how you welcomed him in fear and trembling.

16.verse: I rejoice because I can rely completely on you.

1.verse: The Collection for the Christians of Jerusalem -Chapter 8 -Example of Christians of Macedonia. -Now we want you to know, brethren, about the grace of God that has been bestowed on the Churches of Macedonia.

2.verse: In a period of severe affliction, their abundant joy and their extreme poverty have overflowed in rich generosity on their part.

3.verse: I can testify that they contributed to the limit of their resources, and even beyond,

4.verse: begging us insistently for the privilege of sharing in this service to the saints.

5.verse: Far exceeding our expectations, they gave themselves first to the Lord, and then, by the will of God, to us.

6.verse: As a result, we urged Titus that, inasmuch as he had already begun this work of charity, he should bring this enterprise to a successful completion among you.

7.verse: The Example of Christ. -Now, inasmuch as you excel in everything—in your faith, your eloquence, your knowledge, your concern for others, and your love for us—so we want you also to excel in this generous undertaking.

8.verse: I am not saying this to you as a command, but rather I am testing the genuine character of your love by the concern you show for others.

9.verse: For you are well aware of the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ. Although he was rich, he became poor for your sake so that by his poverty you might become rich.

10.verse: I will now give you my advice about what I believe is appropriate in this matter. Last year, you were the first not only to engage in this good work but also to do so willingly.

11.verse: Now finish it, so that your eagerness may be matched by completing it according to your means.

12.verse: As long as the goodwill is present, the gift will be acceptable according to what one has, not according to what one does not have.

13.verse: I am not suggesting that others should have relief while you are reduced to difficult straits. Rather, there should be an equitable balance.

14.verse: Your surplus at the present time should relieve the needs of others, so that at another time their surplus may relieve your needs, and in this way there will be equality.

15.verse: As it is written,“The one who gathered much did not have too much,and the one who gathered less did not have too little.”

16.verse: Paul Recommends the Delegates. -Thanks be to God for putting into the heart of Titus a concern for you that is the equal of mine.

17.verse: For he not only welcomed our request, but, because of his great concern, he is coming to you of his own accord.

18.verse: Together with him, we are sending the brother who is praised by all the Churches for his proclamation of the gospel.

19.verse: In addition, he has also been appointed by the Churches to be our traveling companion as we engage in our charitable work for the glory of the Lord and to show our eagerness to be of service.

20.verse: In this way, we want to ensure that no one will be able to criticize us for our handling of this generous collection.

21.verse: For we intend to do what is honorable not only in the Lord’s sight but also in the sight of others.

22.verse: And with them, we are also sending our brother whose dedication we have tested in many ways and found to be exemplary. Now he is even more dedicated than before because of his great confidence in you.

23.verse: As for Titus, he is my partner and coworker in your service. And as for the others, they are the apostles of the Churches and the glory of Christ.

24.verse: Therefore, show these men, and all the Churches, the proof of your love and the legitimacy of our boasting about you.

1.verse: Chapter 9 -Let the Offering Be Ready. -In regard to the ministry toward the saints, there really is no necessity for me to write to you.

2.verse: For I am fully aware of your eagerness to help, which has been the subject of my boasting about you to the Macedonians, telling them that Achaia has been ready since last year. Your ardor has excited most of them.

3.verse: Nevertheless, I am sending the brethren to ensure that our boasts about you may not seem to have been offered in vain. I want you to be as prepared as I said you would be.

4.verse: For if I bring some Macedonians with me and they come to the realization that you are not prepared, it would be a source of shame to us—to say nothing of you—because of our confidence in you.

5.verse: Therefore, I thought it necessary to encourage the brethren to go on to you ahead of us and arrange in advance for the gift that you have promised, so that it may be ready as a genuine gift and not as something that has been granted grudgingly.

6.verse: God Loves a Cheerful Giver. -Remember this: if you sow sparingly, you will reap sparingly, and if you sow generously, you will reap generously as well.

7.verse: Each person should give as much as he has decided in his heart, not with reluctance or under compulsion, for God loves a cheerful giver.

8.verse: And God is able to enrich you with an abundance of every grace, so that, with all of your needs provided for, you may be able to produce a surplus of good works.

9.verse: As it is written,“He scatters abroad his gifts to the poor;his righteousness lasts forever.”

10.verse: Generosity Will Prompt Thanksgiving. -The one who provides seed for sowing and bread for food will supply and multiply your seed and increase the harvest of your righteousness.

11.verse: Enriched in every way, you will be able to practice all your acts of generosity, which, through our intervention, will result in thanksgiving to God.

12.verse: The administering of this public service not only helps to satisfy the needs of the saints but also overflows in countless acts of thanksgiving to God.

13.verse: Through the evidence of such service, you are giving glory to God for your obedient profession of the gospel of Christ and the generosity of your contribution to them and to all others as well.

14.verse: At the same time, their hearts will go out to you in their prayers for you, because of the surpassing grace that God has bestowed upon you.

15.verse: Thanks be to God for his indescribable gift.

1.verse: Paul’s Self-Defense -Chapter 10 -Recommendation from Human Beings or from God? -I myself, Paul, exhort you by the gentleness and the mercy of Christ, I who am “timid” when I am face to face with you, but “bold” when I am at a distance!

2.verse: I beg you that when I am in your presence I will not have to act with boldness and the self-assurance that I consider necessary when I oppose some of those who accuse us of acting according to human standards.

3.verse: Although we are human beings, we do not engage in battle according to human standards.

4.verse: For the weapons of our warfare are not merely human, but they possess the divine power to destroy strongholds. We demolish arguments

5.verse: and every proud pretension against the knowledge of God, and we compel every thought to surrender in obedience to Christ.

6.verse: What is more, once your obedience is complete, we are prepared to punish every disobedience.

7.verse: Face the facts squarely. If anyone is confident that he belongs to Christ, he should reflect on the fact that we belong to Christ as much as he does.

8.verse: It is possible that I tend to boast a bit too much about our authority, which the Lord has entrusted to us for building you up rather than for tearing you down, but I will not apologize for doing so.

9.verse: Therefore, I do not want to seem to be someone who frightens you with my letters.

10.verse: Some may assert, “His letters are impressive and forceful, but his personal appearance is insignificant, and he cannot speak well.”

11.verse: Let them understand that what we are in our letters when we are absent will be the same as what we are in our deeds when we are present.

12.verse: We do not dare to rank ourselves or to compare ourselves with any of those who commend themselves. But when they measure themselves by one another and compare themselves with one another, they only demonstrate their ignorance.

13.verse: In contrast, we will not boast beyond the proper limits. Rather, we will measure ourselves according to the standard that God laid down for us, which enabled us to reach out all the way to you.

14.verse: We are not overreaching ourselves as we would be if we had not come to you; indeed, we came to you with the gospel of Christ.

15.verse: Neither are we boasting immoderately of the labors of others. Our hope is rather that, as your faith increases, our influence among you will be greater than ever,

16.verse: so that we may preach the gospel to regions beyond you, rather than boasting about work already done in someone else’s region.

17.verse: If anyone would boast, let him boast in the Lord.

18.verse: For it is not the one who commends himself who is really approved, but the one whom the Lord commends.

1.verse: Chapter 11 -Promised to One Spouse. -I hope that you will put up with a little of my foolishness. Please bear with me.

2.verse: For I am jealous of you with a godly jealousy, since I promised all of you to one spouse, to present you as a chaste virgin to Christ.

3.verse: However, I am afraid that, just as the serpent deceived Eve by his cunning, your thoughts may be led astray from a singlehearted fidelity to Christ.

4.verse: For if someone comes and proclaims another Jesus than the one we proclaimed, or if you receive a different spirit from the one you received, or a different gospel from the one you accepted, you put up with that readily enough!

5.verse: I do not regard myself as being inferior to these “super-apostles.”

6.verse: I may be untrained in the art of speaking, but the same is not true of me in regard to knowledge. In every way and in all respects, we have made this evident to you.

7.verse: Paul’s Apostolate. -Did I make a mistake by preaching the gospel of God without charge, humbling myself so that you might be exalted?

8.verse: I robbed other Churches, accepting support from them in order to serve you.

9.verse: And when I was with you and in need, I did not burden anyone, for the brethren who came from Macedonia supplied my needs.I refrained, and will continue to refrain, from burdening you in any way.

10.verse: As surely as the truth of Christ is in me, this boast of mine will not be silenced in the regions of Achaia.

11.verse: And why? Because I do not love you? God knows I do.

12.verse: And I shall continue to do just as I am doing at present in order to thwart the efforts of those who are seeking the opportunity to be regarded as my equals in the aspects they boast about.

13.verse: Such people are false apostles, dishonest workers who masquerade as apostles of Christ.

14.verse: And no wonder! Even Satan masquerades as an angel of light.

15.verse: Therefore, it should not be considered unusual that his servants also disguise themselves as ministers of righteousness. Their end will be appropriate to their deeds.

16.verse: Paul’s Boast. -I repeat: let no one take me for a fool. However, if you do, then treat me like a fool and let me boast a little.

17.verse: In saying this, I am not speaking according to the Lord but out of foolishness in the conviction that I have something to boast about.

18.verse: Since many boast of their human accomplishments, I will do likewise.

19.verse: Since you are wise yourselves, you gladly put up with fools!

20.verse: For you endure it if someone makes slaves of you, or robs you of all you possess, or takes advantage of you, or puts on airs, or slaps you in the face.

21.verse: To my shame, I must admit that we have been too weak for that sort of thing!But whatever anyone dares to boast of—I am speaking out of foolishness—I also dare to boast of.

22.verse: Are they Hebrews? So am I. Are they Israelites? So am I. Are they descendants of Abraham? So am I.

23.verse: Are they ministers of Christ? (I am talking now like a madman.) I am too, having endured far greater labors, far more imprisonments, far harsher scourgings, and far more brushes with death.

24.verse: Five times I received from the Jews forty lashes minus one.

25.verse: Three times I was beaten with rods; once I was stoned; three times I was shipwrecked; once I was adrift in the open sea for a night and a day.

26.verse: I have traveled continually and faced dangers from rivers, dangers from robbers, dangers from my own people, dangers from Gentiles, dangers in the city, dangers in the desert, dangers at sea, and dangers from false brethren.

27.verse: I have endured toil and hardship, and sleepless nights. I have been hungry and thirsty, and I have often gone without food. I have been cold, and often all but naked.

28.verse: Apart from these external things, I am burdened each and every day with the anxiety of caring for all the Churches.

29.verse: Who is weak, and I am not similarly afflicted? Who is led into sinfulness, and I am not filled with indignation?

30.verse: If I must boast, I will boast of the things that exhibit my weakness.

31.verse: The God and Father of the Lord Jesus knows—he who is blessed forever—that I am telling the truth.

32.verse: When I was in Damascus, the governor under King Aretas assigned guards around the city of Damascus in order to arrest me.

33.verse: However, I was let down in a basket through a window in the wall, and I thereby escaped from his clutches.

1.verse: Chapter 12 -Caught Up into Heaven. -Although nothing is to be gained by doing so, I must continue to boast. So I will move on to the visions and revelations given me from the Lord.

2.verse: I know a man in Christ who fourteen years ago (whether in the body or out of the body I do not know—God knows) was caught up to the third heaven.

3.verse: And I know that this man (whether in the body or out of the body I do not know—God knows)

4.verse: was caught up into paradise and heard inexpressible things, things that no man may repeat.

5.verse: About this man I am willing to boast, but about myself I will not boast, except as it concerns my weaknesses.

6.verse: Actually, if I were to boast, I would not be a fool, because I would be telling the truth. However, I refrain from doing so in order that no one may regard me more highly than would be evident from what he has seen in me and heard from me.

7.verse: A Boast of One’s Weakness. -Therefore, to keep me from becoming unduly elated by the wondrous nature of these revelations, I was given a thorn in the flesh, a messenger of Satan, to beat me and prevent me from becoming unduly elated.

8.verse: Three times I begged the Lord to have it leave me,

9.verse: but he answered me, “My grace is sufficient for you, for power is made perfect in weakness.”Hence, I will boast most gladly of my weaknesses, in order that the power of Christ may dwell within me.

10.verse: For this reason, I rejoice when I endure weaknesses, insults, hardships, persecutions, and distress for the sake of Christ. For it is when I am weak that I am strong.

11.verse: Characteristic Traits of an Apostle. -I have been very foolish, but it was you who drove me to it. I should have been commended by you, for in no way did I prove to be inferior to those super-apostles, even though I am nothing.

12.verse: The traits of a true apostle were evident in what I did in your presence: perseverance, signs, wonders, and mighty deeds.

13.verse: How then have you been less privileged than the other Churches, except that I myself did not place a burden on you? Forgive me for being so unfair!

14.verse: Now I am getting ready to come to you for a third time, and I do not intend to be a burden to you. What I want is not your money, but you yourselves. Children are not expected to save up for their parents, but parents for their children.

15.verse: I will be happy to spend and be spent for you. Are you going to love me less because I love you so much more?

16.verse: In any case, let it be assumed that I myself did not prove to be a burden to you. However, you may say that I was crafty and took you in by a trick.

17.verse: Did I take advantage of you through any of those I sent to you?

18.verse: I urged Titus to come to you, and I sent a brother with him. Did Titus take advantage of you? Did not he and I walk in the same Spirit, in the same footsteps?

19.verse: There Will Be No More Forgiveness. -Have you been supposing all this time that we have been defending ourselves before you? Not at all! We have been speaking in Christ and in the presence of God, my dear ones, doing all things to build you up.

20.verse: I fear that when I come I may find you different from what I wish you to be, and that you may find me different from what you wish me to be.I am afraid that this will lead to quarreling, jealousy, anger, factions, slander, gossip, conceit, and disorder.

21.verse: I fear that when I come back my God may humiliate me in your presence and that I may have to mourn over many who previously sinned and have not repented of the impurity, immorality, and licentiousness in which they have indulged.

1.verse: Chapter 13 -This will be the third visit I am making to you. Every charge must be established on the testimony of two or three witnesses.

2.verse: I warned those who have sinned, as well as everyone else, and I warn them now in my absence as I did when present on my second visit: when I come again, I will spare no one.

3.verse: This will give you the proof you seek that Christ is speaking in me. He is not weak in dealing with you, but he is powerful among you.

4.verse: For he was crucified in weakness, but he is now alive by the power of God. Similarly, we are weak in him, but in dealing with you we will live in the power of God.

5.verse: Examine Yourselves. -Examine yourselves to see whether you are in the faith. Test yourselves. Do you not realize that Jesus Christ is in you? If he is not, then you have failed the test.

6.verse: It is my hope that you will come to the realization that we have not failed.

7.verse: But we pray to God that you may not do anything wrong—not so that we may appear to have passed the test, but so that you may do what is right, even though we may appear to have failed.

8.verse: We have no power to do anything against the truth but only for the truth.

9.verse: We rejoice when we are weak, just as long as you are strong. This is what we desire—that you may become perfect.

10.verse: I am writing this letter prior to my arrival so that when I come I may not have to treat you harshly in exercising the authority that the Lord has given me to build up and not to tear down.

11.verse: Conclusion -Live in Peace. -And now, brethren, farewell. Mend your ways. Encourage one another. Be of one mind and live in peace. Then the God of love and peace will be with you.

12.verse: Greet one another with a holy kiss. All the saints send you greetings.

13.verse: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ and the love of God and the fellowship of the Holy Spirit be with you all.

14.verse: verse doesn't exist in this bible version
